intro: Aridaria varians, commonly known as the variable desert lily, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and tall, erect stems that help it conserve water in harsh environments. The plant produces clusters of showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange, which bloom during the spring and early summer. Its deep root system allows it to access groundwater, enabling survival in drought conditions. Aridaria varians plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
